Mesa, Manila 1016 MEMORANDUM To: Faculty and Staff From: KAITLYN ARNOLD, Dean, College of Arts and Sciences Date: November 03, 2025 Subject: Schedule of Academic Activities for Second Semester This memorandum provides official notification regarding the implementation of enhanced health and safety protocols effective immediately across all university facilities. In compliance with Department of Health (DOH) and Commission on Higher Education (CHED) guidelines, all students, faculty, staff, and visitors must observe the following: proper wearing of face masks in enclosed spaces, regular hand sanitization, maintenance of physical distancing, and completion of daily health declaration forms. Temperature screening will be conducted at all entry points. Individuals presenting symptoms will be denied entry and advised to seek medical consultation. Faculty members must incorporate these protocols into class management procedures. Students who fail to comply may face disciplinary action including suspension of class privileges. All offices must designate health and safety officers. For concerns, contact the University Health Services Office at extension 2345 or email healthservices university edu ph. Thank you for your cooperation. KAITLYN ARNOLD. Dean, College of Arts and Sciences Office of the University President

ocr_text: POLYTECHNIC UNIVERSITY OF THE PHILIPPINES Manila, Metro Manila Office of the President Telephone: (02) 8426 6001 loc. 5100 Email: registrar university edu ph Web: www university edu ph November 15, 2025 UNIVERSITY ANNOUNCEMENT RE: Campus Facilities Maintenance Schedule Greetings! The university administration announces the implementation of flexible learning modality for the upcoming semester to provide quality education while ensuring the health and safety of our academic community. LEARNING MODALITIES AVAILABLE: Face to face classes: For laboratory subjects and specialized courses requiring physical presence Online synchronous: Real time virtual classes via approved learning management platforms Online asynchronous: Self paced learning through recorded lectures and modules Hybrid format: Combination of face to face and online delivery methods Students will be informed of their class modalities through official email and the student portal. Faculty members will provide course syllabi indicating the learning format, schedule, and assessment methods. GUIDELINES AND REQUIREMENTS: All students must maintain reliable internet connection for online classes. Technical requirements include computer or mobile device with camera and microphone. Face to face participants must comply with health protocols. The university commits to providing technical support and learning resources through the Information Technology Services Office and the University Library. For assistance, contact your respective college offices or the Office of Student Affairs. KAYLA STEVENS University Registrar

ocr_text: UNIVERSITY OF THE PHILIPPINES DILIMAN Quezon City, Metro Manila Office of the Chancellor Contact: (02) 8524 4611 Email: admissions university edu ph Website: www university edu ph November 06, 2025 OFFICIAL ANNOUNCEMENT RE: Library Services and Resource Access Guidelines Good day! This serves as official announcement regarding the extension of the enrollment period for the Second Semester, Academic Year 2024 2025. The enrollment deadline has been extended to accommodate students who were unable to complete their registration within the original schedule. EXTENDED ENROLLMENT SCHEDULE: Regular students: Until December 03, 2025 Late enrollment (with surcharge): December 04, 2025 to December 09, 2025 Adding and dropping of subjects: December 06, 2025 to December 13, 2025 All students are required to complete online pre enrollment through the student portal before proceeding to payment. Walk in enrollment is available at the Registrar s Office during office hours (8 00 AM 5 00 PM, Monday to Friday). PAYMENT OPTIONS: Students may settle tuition fees through the following channels: university cashier s office, authorized payment centers, online banking facilities, and accredited payment apps. Official receipts must be secured and uploaded to the student portal. IMPORTANT REMINDERS: Failure to enroll within the extended period will result in forfeiture of slot and may affect scholarship grants. Students with unpaid balances from previous semesters must settle obligations before enrollment. For concerns, contact the Office of the University Registrar. Thank you for your cooperation. CARRIE STEIN University President

label: announcement
ocr_text: UNIVERSITY OF THE PHILIPPINES DILIMAN Quezon City, Metro Manila Office of the Chancellor Tel: (02) 8920 5301 to 8920 5320 Email: info university edu ph Website: www university edu ph November 03, 2025 PUBLIC ANNOUNCEMENT RE: Extension of Enrollment Period for Second Semester AY 2024 2025 Greetings! The university administration announces the implementation of flexible learning modality for the upcoming semester to provide quality education while ensuring the health and safety of our academic community. LEARNING MODALITIES AVAILABLE: Face to face classes: For laboratory subjects and specialized courses requiring physical presence Online synchronous: Real time virtual classes via approved learning management platforms Online asynchronous: Self paced learning through recorded lectures and modules Hybrid format: Combination of face to face and online delivery methods Students will be informed of their class modalities through official email and the student portal. Faculty members will provide course syllabi indicating the learning format, schedule, and assessment methods. GUIDELINES AND REQUIREMENTS: All students must maintain reliable internet connection for online classes. Technical requirements include computer or mobile device with camera and microphone. Face to face participants must comply with health protocols. The university commits to providing technical support and learning resources through the Information Technology Services Office and the University Library. For assistance, contact your respective college offices or the Office of Student Affairs. DEBORAH MERRITT Chancellor
